channel.title: Google News
channel.description: A scraped RSS feed for the Google News En Telegram Channel

item.title: 2023-05-17T09:04:12
item.description:
Google will delete personal accounts inactive for 2 years.

Starting later this year (December 2023), if a Google account has not been used and logged in for at least 2 years, Google can delete the account and its content, including content in Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Drive, Meet, Calendar), YouTube and Google Photos.

This policy applies only to personal Google accounts and does not affect accounts of organizations, such as schools or businesses.

Before the account is deleted, the company will send several notifications in the months leading up to the deletion to both the account's primary and backup email address.

The easiest way to keep your Google account active is to log in at least once every 2 years. You can also sign up for a subscription set up through your Google Account, which would also count as activity.

ðŸ”— Google Blog

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-16T21:55:45
item.description:
Android 13 QPR3 Beta 3.2 bugfix is out.

Build number: T3B3.230413.006 â†’ T3B3.230413.009
Security patch: May 2023

Release Notes:
â€¢ Fixed an input synchronization issue with the system UI that caused windows to stop receiving touch input or to receive touch input in the wrong location. (Issue #279560321)
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause calls over Wi-Fi to disconnect unexpectedly.
â€¢ Fixed issue that could prevent a SIM card from being detected properly or from being activated during phone setup.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where a device could fail to register IMS over Wi-Fi when leaving LTE coverage and entering Wi-Fi coverage.
â€¢ Fixed issues that caused unexpected dips with cellular connectivity speeds or reliability.

item.title: 2023-05-16T16:17:17
item.description:
What customization options will appear in Android 14?

At the Google I/O company showed off new ways to personalize your Android phone that were hinted at in past builds:

â€¢ Lock screen Clock customization
You'll have a choice of several watch face options with the ability to customize their color and size.

â€¢ Lock screen shortcuts customization
 You will be able to select the following shortcuts: Flashlight, Do Not Disturb, Camera, Smart Home Control, Wallet, QR Code Scanner (maybe something else).

â€¢ Emoji wallpaper
It will be possible to customize the combination of emoji, their pattern and colors. The wallpaper will also respond to taps.

â€¢ Cinematic wallpapers
You will be able to create a wallpaper from your photos with a parallax effect.

â€¢ AI Wallpaper Generator
You will be able to create your own wallpaper based on a text query using Googleâ€™s text-to-image diffusion model.

ðŸ”— Google Blog

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-15T22:59:48
item.description:
Gmail for Android will soon add a navigation rail on large screens.

Like on phones, there are no tab labels. And the current page indicator is shaped like a circle instead of a pill. A similar implementation is also used in the upcoming Phone app redesign for tablets.

It is not known when Google is going to deploy this component for all users.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T22:02:30
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 2 Changelog (Part2):

â€¢ Fixed issues with gesture navigation that occurred when using a custom launcher: a) The Home screen content wouldn't display and the animation would fail to render when swiping up to go Home. b) The list of recently used apps couldn't be accessed using the normal gesture.
â€¢ Fixed issues that prevented users from interacting with notifications in the notification shade.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause a device to crash after finishing audio or video calls.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where, after entering and exiting picture-in-picture mode, the screen flickered when any apps were launched.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where user restrictions set by DPC admins were not being enforced in Settings.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where, after taking pictures with the Google Camera app, opening the latest picture from the thumbnail in the app briefly displayed a green-colored shade over the image.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause the battery percentage to be displayed as 0% after a device reboot regardless of the actual charge level of the device.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause a device to crash, and then when the device rebooted any wallpapers that were selected before the reboot were reset.
â€¢ Fixed issues that prevented the Better Bug app from uploading bug reports.
â€¢ Fixed issues that caused the back-to-home gesture to stop working.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause the system Settings app to crash repeatedly.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that prevented users from searching within the system Settings app.
â€¢ Fixed issues that sometimes caused null pointer exceptions for input method editors (IMEs).
â€¢ Fixed an issue that sometimes increased system-wide memory usage unnecessarily.
â€¢ Fixed system issues that could sometimes cause deadlocks.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T22:00:50
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 2 goes live!

Changelog (Part 1):

â€¢ Fixed a platform stability issue that could cause the UI to lag or freeze, apps to crash, or the device to crash.
â€¢ Fixed an issue with the fingerprint sensor that prevented new fingerprints from being added for Fingerprint Unlock in some cases.
â€¢ Fixed issues with UPI and biometrics that could cause some apps to not work properly.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where a device couldn't be unlocked using a fingerprint after tapping a notification or choosing a notification action on the lock screen.
â€¢ Fixed an issue on some devices that caused sound to play through the speakers instead of headphones that were connected.
â€¢ Fixed an issue that caused icons on the home screen to appear almost invisible.


Build: UPB1.230309.017 â†’ UPB2.230407.014
Patch: May 2023

â€¢ OTAs
â€¢ Factory Images

ðŸ”— Register for Android beta testing

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T19:05:50
item.description:
The Google Pixel Fold is available for pre-order starting today for $1799. Available starting June 27.

The pre-order gift includes a free Google Pixel Watch in US, UK and Germany, a Google One subscription with a 2TB plan for 6 months, and 3 months of YouTube Premium.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T18:53:05
item.description:
The Pixel Tablet is available for pre-order starting today for $499. Sales start June 20.

Each tablet will come with a $129 charging dock for free!

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T18:44:03
item.description:
The Pixel 7a will be available starting today for $499. The coral color is exclusive to the Google Store.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T14:35:53
item.description:
Two new leaked videos about the Pixel Fold and Tablet.

SnoopyTech posted two new videos about the upcoming big-screen devices hours before the event, and there's something interesting here:

Pixel Fold:
Apparently, Google hasn't had time to finish adapting for foldable devices for the multitasking, a footnote at the bottom of the video says that "Dual Screen support coming in Fall 2023", namely with the release of Android 14. Also, Google claims it's the "thinnest foldable device" (in markets where the Pixel Fold is sold)

Pixel Tablet:
It's nothing special: a charging dock with speaker, an 11-inch screen, HD video calling on Google Meet, and a reminder of Nearby Share.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T08:22:41
item.description:
Google is already promoting the Pixel Fold with NBA stars.

On the YouTube channel Made by Google appeared the video "Google Pixel x NBA: The Greatest Watch Party", which is available only by link. And it was published by twitter account GooglePixel_US. Most likely, the video was supposed to appear after the I/O event, but it turned out as it happened. Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯

The commercial demonstrates key features of the foldable device's software, such as adapting the Meet app when the device is fully or partially opened or taking selfies with the rear camera when the image is displayed on an external display.

Also in the video you can catch Pixel 7a in coral coloring.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-10T07:15:46
item.description:
Today is Google I/O 2023!

Today's event will talk about Google's latest solutions, products and technologies, from artificial intelligence and cloud computing to mobile and web technologies.

But of course, the most interesting part for you will be Android 14 and the new devices from Google, namely the Pixel 7a, Pixel Fold, Pixel Tablet with docking station and the new color for the Pixel Buds A-series.

It's also possible that the company will show a teaser of the upcoming Pixel 8, 8 Pro and Pixel Watch 2.

The presentation will be available to watch on Google I/O website or on YouTube.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-08T10:29:58
item.description:
Google Photos Edit tool will be optimized for tablets in landscape mode.

Until now, it has looked like a stretched mobile version, but Google will soon change that. The main editing tools will now be on the right, while the photo being edited will be displayed on the left. But some adjustment elements will still appear below the photo. Portrait mode remained unchanged.

This layout was possible to enable in the latest version of the Google Photos app, and at the moment, it is hidden from users.

Google News | En
